rows.text: When a variety of crops are grown in the same field, this makes better use of nutrients in the soil, and many plants benefit from each other. These can either be:
rows.subtext:
* In rotation, with one crop following each other
* As an intercrop, with two or more crops at the same time in the field

rows.text: Legume crops are able to bring in nitrogen from the air and feed the soil and other crops, (see legume nodule at left).  Some long-growing legumes like cowpea, lablab, alfalfa, mung bean, and pigeon pea do this very well, while short season legumes like bean and soya bean do it less well.

Compared to annual crops that grow and die in one season, (see at right) perennial crops like grasses that grow in pastures, boundary plantings of forage grasses, alfalfa, and shrubs, generated lot of roots and these are very good for soils.
Crops in fields and field boundaries should use the benefits of diverse crops, shrubs, and trees.
